alert.note: Alert for Adams; Wells (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 9:09PM EDT until March 28 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River near Linn Grove. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The flooding of county roads begin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Friday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 11.7 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
